uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib
Class MiscUtil

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.MiscUtil

public class MiscUtil
extends Object

MiscUtil is a static utility class for methods that don't fit anywhere else. In general if this class contains a large number of methods that can be conceptually grouped, then they should be moved to their own utility class.

Author:
Hamish Morgan <hamish.morgan@sussex.ac.uk>

Method Detail

humanReadableBytes

public static String humanReadableBytes(long bytes)
Format the provided integer parameter in units of bytes as a human-readable string. For example 2048 produces become "2KiB". Uses non-SI (1024 base) EIC units.

Parameters:
bytes - The number to make a human readable units string from.
Returns:
human readable string representation of the number of bytes

humanReadableBytes

public static String humanReadableBytes(long bytes,
                                        boolean si,
                                        boolean iec)
Format the provided integer parameter in units of bytes as a human-readable string. For example 2048 produces become "2KiB".

The output can be in either SI base units (multiples of 1000) or the more traditional multiples of 1024 (210). In the case that multiples of 1024 are used, the correct IEC units infix an i character. For example using KiB for kilobyte instead of kB.

Parameters:
bytes - The number to make a human readable units string from.
si - whether to not to use SI (1000) units, use 1024 otherwise
iec - whether or not use IEC units (e.g KiB)
Returns:
human readable string representation of the number of bytes

maxMemory

public static long maxMemory()
Returns the maximum amount of memory that the Java virtual machine will attempt to use. If there is no inherent limit then the value Long.MAX_VALUE will be returned.

Note that this value has no bearing on the actual physical memory availability of the underlying machine, only the upper limit on what the Java Virtual Machine will attempt to allocate.

Returns:
the maximum amount of memory that the virtual machine will attempt to use, measured in bytes

allocatedMemory

public static long allocatedMemory()
Returns the total amount of memory in the Java virtual machine. The value returned by this method may vary over time, depending on the host environment.

Returns:
total amount of memory currently available for current and future objects, measured in bytes.

freeAllocatedMemory

public static long freeAllocatedMemory()
Returns the amount of free memory in the Java Virtual Machine. Calling the Runtime.gc() method may result in increasing the value returned by freeMemory.

Returns:
an approximation to the total amount of memory currently available for future allocated objects, measured in bytes.

usedMemory

public static long usedMemory()
Returns the amount of memory currently used by the Java Virtual Machine. The value returned by this method may vary over time. Calling the Runtime.gc() method may result in a decreasing the value return by usedMemory.

Returns:
an approximation to the amount of memory currently used by allocated objects, measured in bytes.

freeMaxMemory

public static long freeMaxMemory()
Returns the amount of memory available for use by the Java program. This includes memory that has not yet been allocated to the Java Virtual Machine.

Returns:
an approximation to the amount of memory that is available for use by the Java program.

memoryInfoString

public static String memoryInfoString()
Return a human readable string representation of the current memory allocation within the Java Virtual Machine. 
 Memory used=171.7MiB, allocated=444.4MiB, available=1015.7MiB

Returns:
a string containing memory info.

printableUTF8

public static String printableUTF8(char ch)
Produces a string representation of ch that should be printable, and human readable.

For example, when ch is the horizontal-tab character (0x9), the function produces the String "Tab".

The motivation for this function is a parser, where errors need to display something sensible like "expecting Tab but found New-line".

Parameters:
ch - character to print
Returns:
printable representation
